entry.title: How to get the Euphony linear fusion rifle in Destiny 2
entry.summary:
Many of the exotics in Destiny 2 are fairly easy to obtain. Provided you snag yourself a few exotic engrams and take a stroll over to Master Rahool, you'll get a good handful to get you started. Exotic engram focusing and the Monument to Lost Light are more difficult methods for obtaining exotic items but still aren't too bad.
However, some exotics come from the game's hardest pieces of content. Here's how to get the Euphony linear fusion rifle in Destiny 2.
Where to find the Euphony in Destiny 2
Image via Bungie.
The Euphony is rewarded as a random drop from completing the final encounter of the Salvation's Edge raid, The Witness. Each successful completion will give you a legendary item and a 5% chance to receive the Euphony. With the way that raid loot works, that gives you three chances each week provided you have three separate characters at the right power level for it.
There are two ways to increase your chances of getting the Euphony. The first method is to simply complete that final encounter and not receive the Euphony. Each time you don't, you'll increase your chances to get the Euphony slightly more. This chance resets upon receiving the Euphony. The other method is through triumphs. If you can complete certain challenges during different encounters for the raid, you can claim them on your Triumphs page (found under Journey in your Inventory) to increase the drop chance.
Is the Euphony worth using?
The Euphony's main perk causes sustained damage with the weapon to spawn Threadlings. Alongside this, any Threadling damage from the Euphony or otherwise will add a stack of Spindle, increasing the weapon's damage by 2%. This stacks 25 times. This naturally makes the weapon great for a Threadling build, though on its own it's mediocre at best. It should also only be used on Warlock since it's the best class for it thanks to the new Swarmers exotic leg armor.

entry.title: How to get training points in Madden NFL 25
entry.summary:
When you start playing Madden NFL 25, training points might not be on top of your priorities. After all, this specific currency is exclusive to the Ultimate Team. If you're like me and enjoy the Franchise mode now, you won't have to bother too much.
But if you're passionately into building up the best possible fantasy team with colorful cards, having a healthy stack of training points will be necessary.
Best way to get training points in Madden NFL 25
The simplest and easiest way to get training points is to sell the player cards you don't need. When you start building up your team, there won't be a huge surplus collection of cards. But that number will change as you complete more objectives and grind the different game modes.
Image via Destructoid
You can sell these players for coins. But doing that with every card might not be the optimum path. Instead, you can exchange them for training points. The lower-rated items hardly give a sufficient amount of points. That changes when you exchange cards with higher overall ratings. This is also a great way to utilize BND items that can't be sold on the market.
While this method is the best and most sustainable way of getting training points, holding on to your cards for now is best. Madden NFL 25 is still in the opening week of full launch, and it's better to hold on to your higher-rated cards as they help to improve your offense and defense.
In Ultimate Team, EA Sports also provides a Training Shuffle Pack program. But I am not a gambling person, and it's best to hold on to your existing points. Once you have a better idea about the auction market, make sure to get higher-rated items for cheap.
Once you quicksell them, you can get many training points to develop your available cards. This flipping method benefits those who can devote a certain amount of time to snipe higher-rated items for cheap.

entry.title: Will: Follow the Light looks like it will be a detailed take on the narrative adventure genre
entry.summary:
TomorrowHead Studio has revealed its debut game at the Future Game Show today. Will: Follow the Light is a narrative adventure focused on the authenticity of its travel and puzzle systems. It’s coming to PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.
I’d refer to it as a walking sim, but I think that would be a misnomer since the trailer focuses just as much on dog sledding and sailing. I mean, I think it fits the genre’s criteria not the name.
Anyway, Will: Follow the Light casts you as a man appropriately named Will who is traveling north to find his lost son. According to the press release, “It explores the relationship between father and son in an adventure taking players on an emotional rollercoaster through wild thunderstorms, the ringing silence of loneliness, and a tale about the importance of caring for loved ones.” Oh okay.
What I find most interesting is the “realistic controls” of the sailing yacht. The travel segments of the trailer do seem pretty detailed. Moreover, they also say there’s a lifelike navigation system. I have hopes that there is a lot of travel and navigation in Will: Follow the Light, because I feel that it tends to get downplayed in a world with omnipresent fast travel. In games, I mean. Fast travel in real life hasn’t been figured out yet, as far as I know.
The puzzles also seem detailed, as they’re said to be “rooted in real life.” It shows weights being added to an elevator’s counterweight which is kind of neat. It might beat adventure game logic, but maybe not. There might be a reason why few games use puzzles “rooted in real life.”

entry.title: How to get Refined Iron Sand in Black Myth: Wukong
entry.summary:
Refined Iron Sand is going to be a bit of a rare resource as you get through Chapter 2 of Black Myth: Wukong. It’ll be needed to craft the next level of weapon gear after the Wind Bear Staff.
In any case, here’s what you need to know on how to get the resource so you can craft the next tier of staves.
How to get Refined Iron Sand in Black Myth: Wukong
To get Refined Iron Sand in Black Myth: Wukong, you have to progress into Chapter 3 of the story. After defeating the Yellow Wind Sage, you should get one piece of this.
Next, you’ll find more by exploring the side areas and opening chests. However, you’ll still need a few to craft the staff.
Keep going until you get to the Mirrormere area. This will be the second Shrine you find in the third chapter. When you arrive at Mirrormere, you can activate the Shrine and actually buy one unit of Refined Iron Sand.
With only one left to get, you will have to defeat the Kang-Jin Loong boss just up ahead at the frozen lake. You’ll be thrown into a new area in this chapter upon defeating her. The final pieces of Refined Iron Sand you’ll need should be in chests in the Pagoda Realm.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Much like Silk and other materials that were once scarce, Refined Iron Sand will become a more common resource as you progress through Black Myth: Wukong.
Make it a habit to periodically check the shop either from NPCs or Shrines to see if you can buy a few more units of crafting materials such as this. It’ll speed up the process of getting better gear as you further progress through the game.
Items from these shops are going to cost Will, but you can always farm that up in areas with dense enemy spawns.

entry.title: Epic Games launches Fortnite Web Shop
entry.summary:
Epic Games has recently launched the Fortnite Web Shop, creating another way for players to see and buy Fortnite stuff from the Item Shop.
This Web Shop works similarly to how the in-game Item Shop works in Fortnite. Players can also purchase items by applying Support-A-Creator codes, just like they can in the game on their console or PC.
This is beneficial for players who like to keep track of what’s available in the shop, especially when there’s a specific item that they are waiting to arrive in the shop, without having to hop onto Fortnite.
The Fortnite Web Shop refreshes every day at 5:00 p.m. PT. Each time, it may introduce new items, and some might go out of rotation. At the time of writing, the shop has skins for Marvel’s Hulk, Hela, Deadpool, Wolverine, and Guardians of the Galaxy. There are also John Wick, Ninja, Lewis Hamilton, Raiden, and Loserfit outfits and bundles that you can pick up.
If you wish to apply a creator code to support your favorite content creators, you can click the star badge on the top-right of the Fortnite Web Shop and add the respective code before you make your purchase.
Epic Games' decision reflects their ongoing efforts to create independent avenues to engage with Fortnite. This also means that players now have the option to purchase in-game items without relying on stores from the likes of Apple or Google, forgoing the platform fee along the way.
Epic Games battled both Apple and Google to prove that both companies hold a monopoly over the app market in their respective stores. While Epic Games lost its case against Apple, they were victorious over Google, which was found guilty of holding a monopoly over the Android app market.

entry.title: How to make Seafood Boil in Disney Dreamlight Valley
entry.summary:
Disney Dreamlight Valley has numerous seafood recipes, from large platters to the famous bouillabaisse. Among the list is a dish known as seafood boil, which, although it has some hints from its appearance, doesn't have any obvious indicators of its exact ingredient list.
Seafood Boil recipe
In Disney Dreamlight Valley, Seafood Boil is a four-star recipe requiring the following ingredients:
Any seafood
Any spice
Potato
Corn
Screenshot by Destructoid
While the first two ingredients are flexible in what you can use, the potato and corn are mandatory to complete this meal. Once you have all four items, toss them into a cooking pot alongside a piece of coal to create your seafood dish.
How to get Seafood Boil ingredients
Although you have some freedom on what seafood and spices you can use, you'll still need to get a few mandatory ingredients for Seafood Boil. It's also important not to swap seafood for fish, as that'll mess up the dish you create. Here are the locations for all four items:
Any seafood: Includes oysters, scallops, and shrimp. Commonly found in Dazzle Beach.
Any spice: Includes basil, oregano, and garlic. Found in all biomes.
Potato: Purchase from Wild Tangle or Forgotten Lands Goofy Stalls
Corn: Purchase from Glittering Dunes or Dazzle Beach Goofy Stalls
Generally speaking, you're good to go if you have some spices and seafood from any source alongside potatoes and corn. You also don't have to use the same combination every time to maximize the energy or star coin value of your meal.

entry.title: How to make Bird Food in Disney Dreamlight Valley
entry.summary:
During Disney Dreamlight Valley's Palace of Time and Jafar's Laboratory quests, you'll explore Jafar's castle to confront him and stop Eternity Isle's curse once and for all. However, to find the final key, you'll need to talk to a picky raven and cook some bird food using vegetables and fish.
How to make Bird Food during The Palace of Time
Unlike regular recipes in Disney Dreamlight Valley, bird food requires a bit of puzzle-solving. Below is a quick list of ingredients you need:
Ripe Tomato
Ripe Carrot
Rotten Fish
Rotten Clam
You'll discover a hint to this recipe by reading the journal next to the ingredient table. Although it doesn't explicitly tell you all four items, it'll reveal that the raven loves rotten seafood and fresh vegetables.
Screenshot by Destructoid
When you first open the laboratory's ingredient table, however, you won't find the rotten fish immediately. Instead, you'll see four ripe items, two of which you need for the recipe. Pick up the ripe carrot and tomato before interacting with the nearby hourglass.
Once you interact with the hourglass, all four items will turn rotten. Although you don't need all four items, the rotten clam and fish are key components to this dish. It may be gross to us, but the raven loves it.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Now that you have the bird food, bring it to the raven to advance one step closer to completing Jafar's Laboratory quest. The raven will give you a power coil, which you'll use to power up the nearby pillar and unlock the door. Developed well over two decades ago, the original Silent Hill 2 is the magnum opus of Polish horror stalwarts Bloober Team. Running on then-innovative "Unreal Engine 5" technology created by Jazz Jackrabbit publishers Epic MegaGames, it's a wonderful abyss of a game that remains perfectly playable today, given a certain amount of tolerance for the quirks of the era. It begins with your character, James Sunderland, descending from the road towards the eponymous Midwestern nowhere-town. Like many games of the period, Silent Hill 2 uses a third-person, over-the-shoulder manual camera, which allows you to glance fearfully up at the monstrous pine trees that fringe the path - each rising from a bulging tide of fog that menaces with the suggestion of approaching figures. There is moisture everywhere, gushing from drain pipes and dribbling down concrete barriers. As you amble into the murk, deathly chords and groaning, unmechanical motifs reverberate from somewhere deep underground.

entry.title: Even with some annoyances, game streaming can feel like a Steam Deck cheat code

The Deck’s compatibility issues aren’t nearly as issue-some as they were at launch, but between its Linux-based SteamOS and its relatively mild processing power, but it is true that beefier Windows handhelds will more likely cater to your entire cross-launcher library. Unless, that is, you get something else to run them for you. Streaming games on the Steam Deck has emerged as a nifty workaround for the portable PC’s lingering compatibility woes, making even officially unsupported games playable. Its sequel, Splitgate 2 is continuing that gimmick but is also sprucing up the free-to-play arena shooter with a few modern additions, like bum-sliding around corners and big deployable bubbles called "time domes" that slow down your enemies yet speed up your allies. All this and more comes from a gameplay trailer that went up yesterday. Read more

entry.title: I hope you've got a spare 190GB kicking about for God Of War Ragnarok on PC
entry.summary: The new God Of War duology has my favourite snow in gaming. I can take or leave about 60% of everything else in them, but lawdy, that snow! In God Of War Ragnarok, the action kicks off a during the apocalyptic fimbulwinter, which is probably bad for some characters I don’t care about, but it is good for me personally, because there’s a lot of snow to play with. How much snow, you ask? 190 flippin’ gigs worth, apparently, according to Sony’s system requirements. Read more

entry.title: Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2 PvP multiplayer certainly has that old timey Gears Of War energy
entry.summary: Yesterday, Nic took James and I on a tour of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2's co-op campaign. A merry old time was had, romping through fortress cities like a small herd of crusader buffalo, using the game's absurd jetpack functionality to pancake invading Tyranids, and getting our screens so slathered in gore we couldn't work out who was killing what. It looks like the gargantuan action game's PvP multiplayer will be even messier. Saber and Focus Home have released an extended trailer that walks you through two major modes - the PvE boss and wave-slaying frenzy of Operations, and the 12-player PvP carnage of Eternal War, which spans a range of match types. The ecstasy of dying for the Emperor aside, both give me frightful flashbacks to the early days of Gears Of War. Read more
